description.narrative: The project aims to create better livelihoods and gender inclusion for people working along the Development Minerals value chain in ACP Countries.

activity-description.narrative: Implementation support in Fiji, Programme focus country. ACP-EU Development Minerals Programme: Phase II
Implementation support in Jamaica. Programme focus country. ACP-EU Development Minerals Programme: Phase II
Implementation support in Zambia. Programme focus country. ACP-EU Development Minerals Programme: Phase II
Implementation support. Programme focus country. ACP-EU Development Minerals Programme: Phase II
Implementation support. Programme focus country. ACP-EU Development Minerals Programme: Phase II
Programme Management Team. Programme support in Cameroon. Implementation of the Development Minerals Programme: Phase II in 49 ACP countries and 6 programme focus countries.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: - Number of ACP countries with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs - Number of ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support - Number of ACP countries with geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2: - Number of ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices - Number of ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3: - Number of ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion - Number of training programmes with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities - Number of ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4: - Number of women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills - Number of staff of regulatory agencies, local governments, potential buyer companies and financial institutions trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector - Number of government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices
Output 5: - Num

comment.narrative:
Output 1: Institutions in ACP countries have improved business enabling environment for gender-inclusive, operationalisation and formalisation of ASMEs along the Development Minerals value chain - 8 ACP countries with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs - 4475 that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support - 6 ACP countries with geodata maps created/geodata inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2: ASMEs have enhanced entrepreneurial skills and access to finance, technology, markets and market information; and better regulations - 1258 ASMEs/cooperatives/chambers/associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices - 60 ASMEs that applied for/obtained small grants credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3: Public institutions, communities, women’s organisations and CSOs have strengthened capacity to put in place social and environmental safeguards in mining and quarrying of Development Minerals - 299 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion - 42 training programmes with thematic relevance to the Development Minerals developed by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations, and other training entities - 94 ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4: Women-owned ASMEs are supported to operate in the Development of Minerals value-chain - 153 wo

2022 Output 1 6 ACP countries with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs 250 ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support 2 ACP countries with geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2 200 ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices 40/20 ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors Output 3 240/130 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion 2 training programs with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities 80 ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4 130 women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills 60 staff of regulatory agencies, local governments, potential buyer companies and financial institutions trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector 80 government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices
Output 5 7 research studies conducted, including on sustainable development, climate change, disaster risk management and Development Minerals 550 stakeholders who have increased knowledge and positive attitude towards ASMEs and gender inclusion, affirmative procurement policies in Development Minerals because of South-South knowledge exchange activities organised on Development Minerals

2020 Output 1 1 ACP country with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs 20 ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support 1 ACP countries with geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2 100 ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices 100/50 ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors Output 3 20/20 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion 1 training program with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities 5 ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4 40 women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills
Output 5 2 research studies conducted, including on sustainable development, climate change, disaster risk management and Development Minerals 100 stakeholders who have increased knowledge and positive attitude towards ASMEs and gender inclusion, affirmative procurement policies in Development Minerals because of South-South knowledge exchange activities organised on Development Minerals
